description:
DEGARELIX (deg a REL ix) treats prostate cancer. It works by decreasing levels of the hormone testosterone in the body. This prevents prostate cancer cells from spreading or growing. It belongs to a group of medications called GnRH blockers.
This medicine may be used for other purposes; ask your health care provider or pharmacist if you have questions.
COMMON BRAND NAME(S): Degarelix, Firmagon
side_effects:
Side effects that you should report to your care team as soon as possible:
Allergic reactions or angioedema—skin rash, itching or hives, swelling of the face, eyes, lips, tongue, arms, or legs, trouble swallowing or breathing
Heart rhythm changes—fast or irregular heartbeat, dizziness, feeling faint or lightheaded, chest pain, trouble breathing
Side effects that usually do not require medical attention (report to your care team if they continue or are bothersome):
Hot flashes
Pain, redness, or irritation at injection site
Weight gain
This list may not describe all possible side effects. Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.
monitoring:
Your condition will be monitored carefully while you are receiving this medication. You may need blood work while taking this medication.
Do not rub or scratch injection site. There may be a lump at the injection site, or it may be red or sore for a few days after your dose.
This medication may cause infertility. Talk to your care team if you are concerned about your fertility.
